channel.description: We invite you to come listen and participate in the conversations that are glorifying the Lord in encouraging our sisters in Christ to keep walking with the Lord in all aspects of our lives. God blesses and we shall continue to support and encourage each other to keep walking in the Lord as God has called each of us to do so. This Podcast was created using www.talkshoe.com

item.title: WL4J Encouragement Hour - WL4J Honesty Week
item.author: founder@womenliving4jesus.org
item.description:
What is honesty and why is it so important? What's wrong with a little white lie or living a lie? if you are currently unhappy with something that has either happened in your past, or present, it very well may hinder your future. The Bible actually has a lot to say about honesty, as God has called Christians to be honest people. Even little white lies to protect someone's feelings can compromise your faith. Remember that speaking and living the truth help those around us come to the Truth.
Honesty is a direct reflection of your inner character. Your actions are a reflection on your faith, and reflecting the truth in your actions is a part of being a good witness. Learning how to be more honest will also help you keep a clear conscious.
Character plays a big role in where you go in your life. Honesty is considered a characteristic employers and college interviewers look for in candidates. When you are faithful and honest, it shows.
Being honest is not always easy. As Christians we know how easy it is to fall into sin. Therefore, you need to work at being truthful, and it is work. The world does not give us easy situations, and sometimes we need to really work to keep our eyes on God in order to find the answers. Being honest can sometimes hurt, but knowing that you are following what God wants for you will make you more faithful in the end.
Honesty is also not just how you speak to others, but also how you speak to yourself. While humility and modesty is a good thing, being too harsh on yourself is not being truthful. Also, thinking too highly of yourself is a sin. Thus, it is important for you to find a balance of knowing your blessings and shortcomings so you can continue to grow.

item.itunes:subtitle: WL4J Encouragement Hour - WL4J Honesty Week

item.title: Accepting Affection - Passing Love
item.author: founder@womenliving4jesus.org
item.description:
Join Sister Alissa Lynne as the topic tonight is Tonight's topic is Accepting Affection - Passing Love We will be discussing how some of us are not able to show affection in the areas of our life that is needed for others such as family and significant others. We will be taking this conversation to the place that many do not discuss within the church, intimacy with our spouses along with accepting the love of our spouse. Some of us are married with no love in the marriage and not sure whyâ?¦could it be something that you are doing or not doing? Come find out as we as sisters come together to discuss how to see what is really going on and how to know when something needs fix. Believe it or not, it is all in the word of Godâ?¦it is all there!
Come join us this eveningâ?¦I promise to try not to be so blunt! LOL Yet the Lord has laid a lot on me about this subject and what some of us women suffer from and not even really realize that we are suffering. There is growth room for all of us and may we each learn from each otherâ?¦feel free to just listen in or even call in, or join the other sisters in chat â?? you can ask questions via email, chat or even call in and ask in person. The word of God has it all! Single sister come learn â?? married sister come be helped or to help encourage othersâ?¦let us come together as one body and give the experience, wisdom and knowledge that God has blessed you with to share with others about His love has done for you and your marriage!

item.title: EPISODE62 - Women Living 4 Jesus's Community Call
item.author: founder@womenliving4jesus.org
item.description:
Join Sister Alissa Lynne, Founder of Women Living 4 Jesus and Host of WL4J Encouragement Hour Internet Talk Show as we discuss Bringing the Change in the New Year A New Outlook, A New Possibility, A New You
Everyone looks forward to a New Year as it brings in New Opportunity to change within you. It brings a symbolic look at who we really are and how we can be a better person with a new fresh start, yet we seem to fall out of making the change stay around after a few months of trying. Why do we burn out, what are we doing wrong, let us come together and discuss the change together, let us consider our ways.
